intro: Poacynum sareptanum, commonly known as the Sareptan milkweed, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its milky sap, which is toxic to many animals. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its flowers are usually yellow or greenish-yellow, with five petals and numerous stamens. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological role in its native habitat.
